group_1.textRight: A factory is where things are created.
The products that they make can be completely@different depending on the factory.

group_1.textLeft: That means there are many different@types of factories.

group_1.textRight: Exactly!
For example, our factory is small, so we@can't do mass productions,
but our sheet metal processing skills are@beyond compare.
We even get orders from major manufacturers!

group_1.textLeft: From major companies, too?!
Your technology must be very well-refined.
Wow, that's incredible!

group_1.textRight: Stop, you're making me blush.
Though a while ago, our factory was in@hot water...

group_1.textLeft: Oh, really? What happened?

group_1.textRight: It's a long story, but...I guess I could say that@basically, the whole industry was in deep trouble.
But everything's fine now.

group_1.textLeft: Phew, that's a relief!
It seems there's still so much I need to learn@about the outside world.
Hey, speaking of which...
You've never really talked about that village or settlement thingy where you guys live, ya know?
Isn't it, like, right in the middle of the woods?@Do you guys have bears?

group_1.textRight: Emiri, don't you think you're being rude...?

group_1.textLeft: Nuh-uh! Shizushizu mentioned it herself!
*Giggle* I don't mind!
It's true, I did grow up in a rural area.

group_1.textRight: The place where I grew up isn't as rural@as the Tokime Village...
But it's rural enough.

group_1.textLeft: I'm...not really the one you should be asking.
I was born and raised in the city, unlike@Shizuka and Sunao...you know?

group_1.textRight: Wha? You mean you're all from like,@different places?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, didn't I mention it?

group_1.textRight: I thought you guys were childhood friends.

group_1.textLeft: No, Charu and I met quite recently,
and Shizuka and I met not long before that.
But we're together now, of course!

group_1.textRight: So even though you three are totally different, you work super well together, like one of those@combination machines or something!
What's your secret?

group_1.textLeft: Secret...?
If I had to guess, I'd say it's because we all@share the same values.

group_1.textRight: Ooh, I see...

group_1.textLeft: I'm always thrown off when I talk about this@with girls outside the village.
As members of the Tokime Clan,
we become Magical Girls not for the sake@of our own wishes,
but for the good of the Land of the Rising Sun.
Our job, first and foremost, is to slay Devils -@or Witches - to protect our homeland.

group_1.textRight: So you guys pretty much fight for everyone?

group_1.textLeft: To put it simply, yes.
My wish wasn't for my own benefit, but@for the country's.
...At least, that's what I've been taught.

group_1.textRight: So what you're saying is, you guys all made@a wish to help Japan?

group_1.textLeft: Yes. That's what we take pride in.
I know it's hard for Magical Girls from outside@the village to understand our motivation.
I'm fully aware of that.

group_1.textRight: ...Well, it's true that I don't completely understand where you're coming from.
There's no point in denying it.

group_1.textLeft: Everyone has their own way of thinking, after all.
Even friends sometimes can't see eye to eye.

group_1.textRight: But it doesn't mean it's a rejection of you@as a person.
Yeah, I mean, everyone's got the right to be@proud of their wish!
As long as you have no regrets, it's all good!

group_1.textLeft: ...Regrets?
